Regional Field Managers

Job Description:

The Regional Field Manager asre responsible for the day-to-day operations of the
CDS contracts within their region. Being able to drive and travel throughout their entire
territory is an essential function of this position. They are responsible for assisting on boarding a new employee. They must travel to remote locations in their territory to train new employees to run their route to contract. They must safely operate lifting and
moving equipment, participate in loading operations, and are responsible for the
efficient scheduling of drivers. This position is accountable for clear, timely
communication and paperwork with the Postal Service and the Corporate Office

Essential Functions:

1. Drive/travel to remote areas in their region to assist with on boarding process.
2. Drive/travel to remote areas in their region to conduct training.
3. Plan, coordinate and supervise the contracts/drivers in their region.
4. Plan deliveries by organizing vehicles and implementing sorting/delivery
schedules.
5. Coordinate with Postmaster to ensure proper service.
6. Oversee the loading and unloading of mail onto truck.
7. Coordinate or handle the delivery or recovery of any company vehicle.
8. Schedule/oversee repairs.
9. Oversee cost efficiency of each contract.
10.Fill in on routes when needed.
11.Prepare operational reports to senior management team.
12.Assist with sorting when needed.
13.Perform those additional functions as may be assigned for their region by the
senior management team
14.Travel to and assist in the start up operations and/or training of other regions
when necessary.

Competencies:

1. Acceptable safe driving record
2. Communication Proficiency
3. Ability to Train Others
4. Leadership
5. Organizational Skills.
6. Problem Solving/Analysis.
7. Technical Capacity.
8. Time Management.

Supervisory Responsibility:

This position manages all CDS employees/drivers in the region and is responsible for
the training, performance management, cost efficiency, and hiring/on-boarding of the
employees/drivers within that region. This position will be required to assist in the start
up operations in other regions as well.

Work Environment:

This position is performed on highways/roadways, outside weather conditions, and at
the USPS docks.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to drive long
distances, talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking,
bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee
must frequently lift and/or move items over 75 pounds. Specific vision abilities required
by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth
perception and ability to adjust focus.

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:

This is a full-time position. Hours of work vary depending on the contract. Employees
in this position are expected to work as many hours as it takes to complete the job.
Evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Must be able to
drive and to travel to remote locations.

Driving/Travel:

Ability to drive and travel to remote location within the region isREQUIREDfor this
position. Must have a valid driver's license and meet PFS safe driving standards.

Required Education and Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent
Two years of experience in a Logistics operation or two years management experience

Preferred Experience:

1. Two or more years of experience in transportation operation.
2. Two years of experience in a leadership role.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance:

Must pass the security clearance conducted by the USPS for access to USPS facilities.
Must have registered with selective service ( if required).

Salary/Allowances:

$50,000-$55,000 annual plus $400 a month ($200 bi-monthly) in car
allowance
$50 month cell phone allowance

AAP/EEO Statement:

Postal Fleet Services provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons
regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability,
race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression,
genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran
status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition,
Postal Fleet Services will provide reasonable accommodations that do not create an
undue hardship for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Other Duties:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensivelisting of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for thisjob. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without noticefrom the corporate office. Persons occupying this position must be willing to performany additional assigned duties to assist in CDS operations

JobRequisition.JobDescription:
Regional Field Managers

Job Description:

The Regional Field Manager asre responsible for the day-to-day operations of the
CDS contracts within their region. Being able to drive and travel throughout their entire
territory is an essential function of this position. They are responsible for assisting on boarding a new employee. They must travel to remote locations in their territory to train new employees to run their route to contract. They must safely operate lifting and
moving equipment, participate in loading operations, and are responsible for the
efficient scheduling of drivers. This position is accountable for clear, timely
communication and paperwork with the Postal Service and the Corporate Office

Essential Functions:

1. Drive/travel to remote areas in their region to assist with on boarding process.
2. Drive/travel to remote areas in their region to conduct training.
3. Plan, coordinate and supervise the contracts/drivers in their region.
4. Plan deliveries by organizing vehicles and implementing sorting/delivery
schedules.
5. Coordinate with Postmaster to ensure proper service.
6. Oversee the loading and unloading of mail onto truck.
7. Coordinate or handle the delivery or recovery of any company vehicle.
8. Schedule/oversee repairs.
9. Oversee cost efficiency of each contract.
10.Fill in on routes when needed.
11.Prepare operational reports to senior management team.
12.Assist with sorting when needed.
13.Perform those additional functions as may be assigned for their region by the
senior management team
14.Travel to and assist in the start up operations and/or training of other regions
when necessary.

Competencies:

1. Acceptable safe driving record
2. Communication Proficiency
3. Ability to Train Others
4. Leadership
5. Organizational Skills.
6. Problem Solving/Analysis.
7. Technical Capacity.
8. Time Management.

Supervisory Responsibility:

This position manages all CDS employees/drivers in the region and is responsible for
the training, performance management, cost efficiency, and hiring/on-boarding of the
employees/drivers within that region. This position will be required to assist in the start
up operations in other regions as well.

Work Environment:

This position is performed on highways/roadways, outside weather conditions, and at
the USPS docks.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to drive long
distances, talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking,
bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee
must frequently lift and/or move items over 75 pounds. Specific vision abilities required
by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth
perception and ability to adjust focus.

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:

This is a full-time position. Hours of work vary depending on the contract. Employees
in this position are expected to work as many hours as it takes to complete the job.
Evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Must be able to
drive and to travel to remote locations.

Driving/Travel:

Ability to drive and travel to remote location within the region isREQUIREDfor this
position. Must have a valid driver's license and meet PFS safe driving standards.

Required Education and Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent
Two years of experience in a Logistics operation or two years management experience

Preferred Experience:

1. Two or more years of experience in transportation operation.
2. Two years of experience in a leadership role.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance:

Must pass the security clearance conducted by the USPS for access to USPS facilities.
Must have registered with selective service ( if required).

Salary/Allowances:

$50,000-$55,000 annual plus $400 a month ($200 bi-monthly) in car
allowance
$50 month cell phone allowance

AAP/EEO Statement:

Postal Fleet Services provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons
regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability,
race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression,
genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran
status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition,
Postal Fleet Services will provide reasonable accommodations that do not create an
undue hardship for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Other Duties:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensivelisting of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for thisjob. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without noticefrom the corporate office. Persons occupying this position must be willing to performany additional assigned duties to assist in CDS operations

Courier Truck Drivers - Casing & Delivering Mail Needed in Etna, NH.

Would you be interested in a driving position in Etna NH that cases the mail and then delivers it to mail boxes on a route?

Job consists of casing mail at Etna post office starting at 7:30 am leaving Etna post office at 11:35 am.

You will deliver mail to resident and finish up at 14:09 pm.The route runs 6 days a

week.Monday thru Saturday off on Sunday & Holiday.

Wanna be your own boss? Subcontracting available at $75,000 a year.

  • Includes vehicle with 120 cubes minimum.
  • Includes proper insurance minimum as per USPS requirements.
  • Includes fuels cost
  • Includes drivers and wages.
  • The above can be adjusted if a subcontractor does not have the above conditions.
